abstract: Bangladeshi authorities execute Mir Quasem Ali, leading figure of Jamaat-e-Islami party, for atrocities he was convicted of committing during 1971 war of independence from Pakistan.

headline.print_headline: Islamist Hanged  in Bangladesh  for 1971 Atrocities
headline.main: Islamist Party Figure Executed in Bangladesh for ’71 Atrocities

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Mir Quasem Ali was convicted of murder, confinement, torture and incitement to religious hatred during the 1971 war of independence from Pakistan....
lead_paragraph: Mir Quasem Ali was convicted of murder, confinement, torture and incitement to religious hatred during the 1971 war of independence from Pakistan.
